parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: The name or ID of the repository

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The maximum number of alerts to return

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Must be "id" "firstSeen" "lastSeen" "fixedOn" or "severity"  Defaults to "id"

parameters.name: criteria.alertIds
parameters.description:
If provided, only return alerts with the ids specified.
Otherwise, return any alert.

parameters.name: criteria.alertType
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts of this type. Otherwise, return alerts of all types.

values.description: The code has an unspecified vulnerability type
The code uses a dependency with a known vulnerability.
The code contains a secret that has now been compromised and must be revoked.
The code contains a weakness determined by static analysis.

parameters.name: criteria.confidenceLevels
parameters.description:
If provided, only return alerts at these confidence levels.
Both High and Other need to be specified to fetch alerts of all confidence levels.
Otherwise, return alerts with high confidence level.
Only applicable for secret alerts.

parameters.name: criteria.dependencyName
parameters.description:
If provided, only alerts for this dependency are returned.
Otherwise, return alerts for all dependencies.
In a sarif submission, a dependency (or a component) is specified in result.RelatedLocations[].logicalLocation.
Not applicable for secret alerts.

parameters.name: criteria.fromDate
parameters.description:
If provided, only return alerts last seen after this date.
Otherwise return all alerts.

parameters.name: criteria.hasLinkedWorkItems
parameters.description:
If provided, filters alerts based on whether they have linked work items.
Set to "true" to return only alerts with linked work items.
Set to "false" to return only alerts without linked work items.
If not provided, returns all alerts regardless of linked work items.
Not applicable for secret and dependency scanning alerts.

parameters.name: criteria.keywords
parameters.description: If provided, only return alerts whose titles match this pattern.

parameters.name: criteria.licenseName
parameters.description:
If provided, only alerts created for dependency with this license are returned.
Otherwise, return alerts for all licenses.
In a sarif submission, license for a dependency (or a component) is specified in result.RelatedLocations[].logicalLocation.properties.license.
Not applicable for secret alerts.

parameters.name: criteria.modifiedSince
parameters.description:
If provided, only return alerts that were modified since this date.
Otherwise return all alerts.

parameters.name: criteria.onlyDefaultBranch
parameters.description:
If true or not set, only return alerts found on the default branch of the repository.
If there have been no runs completed on the default branch, the last run is used instead regardless of the branch used for that run. If false, return alerts from all branches.
This option is ignored if ref is provided.
Not applicable for secret alerts.

parameters.name: criteria.phaseId
parameters.description:
If provided with pipelineName, only return alerts detected in this pipeline phase
Otherwise, return alerts detected in all phases.
Not applicable for secret alerts.

parameters.name: criteria.phaseName
parameters.description:
If provided with pipelineName, only return alerts detected in this pipeline phase
Otherwise, return alerts detected in all phases.
Not applicable for secret alerts.

parameters.name: criteria.pipelineName
parameters.description:
If provided, only return alerts detected in this pipeline.
Otherwise, return alerts detected in all pipelines.
Not applicable for secret alerts.

parameters.name: criteria.ref
parameters.description:
If provided, only include alerts for this ref.
If not provided and OnlyDefaultBranch is true, only include alerts found on the default branch or last run branch if there is no analysis configuration for the default branch.
Otherwise, include alerts from all branches.
Not applicable for secret alerts.

parameters.name: criteria.ruleId
parameters.description:
If provided, only return alerts for this rule.
Otherwise, return alerts of all rules.

parameters.name: criteria.ruleName
parameters.description:
If provided, only return alerts for this rule.
Otherwise, return alerts for all rules.

parameters.name: criteria.severities
parameters.description:
If provided, only return alerts at these severities.
Otherwise, return alerts at any severity.

parameters.name: criteria.states
parameters.description:
If provided, only return alerts in these states.
Otherwise, return alerts in any state.

parameters.name: criteria.toDate
parameters.description:
If provided, only return alerts last seen before this date.
Otherwise return all alerts.

parameters.name: criteria.toolName
parameters.description:
If provided with toolName, only return alerts detected by this tool.
Otherwise, return alerts detected by all tools.

parameters.name: criteria.validity
parameters.description:
If provided, only return alerts with the validity specified here. If the validity status is Unknown, fetch alerts of all validity results.
Only applicable for secret alerts.
Filtering by validity status may cause less alerts to be returned than requested with TOP parameter.
Due to this behavior, the ContinuationToken(]]>) in the response header should be relied on to decide if another batch needs to be fetched.

values.description: No Expands.
Return a minimal representation of an alert.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: If there are more alerts than can be returned, a continuation token is placed in the "x-ms-continuationtoken" header.  Use that token here to get the next page of alerts

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: alertId
parameters.description: ID of alert to retrieve

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: Name or id  of a repository that alert is part of

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand attributes of a secret alert. Possible values are `None` and `ValidationFingerprint`. Defaults to `None`. Be aware that if `expand` is set to `ValidationFingerprint`, the response may contain the secret in its unencrypted form. Please exercise caution when using this data.

values.description: No Expands.
Return validationFingerprints in Alert.

patch.description: Update the status of an alert

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The new status of the alert

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: alertId
parameters.description: The ID of the alert

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: The name or ID of the repository

get.description: Get instances of an alert on a branch specified with @ref. If @ref is not provided, return instances of an alert on default branch(if the alert exist in default branch) or latest affected branch.

parameters.name: project

parameters.name: alertId

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: Name or id of a repository that alert is part of

post.description: Get alerts by alert IDs Currently supports fetching secret alerts only.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Request containing alert IDs and optional alert type filter

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: The name or ID of the repository

get.description: Returns the branches for which analysis results were submitted.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: alertType
parameters.description: The type of alert: Dependency Scanning (1), Secret (2), Code QL (3), etc.

values.description: The code has an unspecified vulnerability type
The code uses a dependency with a known vulnerability.
The code contains a secret that has now been compromised and must be revoked.
The code contains a weakness determined by static analysis.

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: A string variable that represents the branch name and is used to fetch branches that follow it in alphabetical order.

parameters.name: branchNameContains
parameters.description: A string variable used to fetch branches that contain this string anywhere in the branch name, case insensitive.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: An int variable used to return the top k branches that satisfy the search criteria.

parameters.name: includePullRequestBranches
parameters.description: A bool variable indicating whether or not to include pull request branches.

alertId.description: Identifier for the alert. It is unique within Azure DevOps organization.

alertType.description: Type of the alert. E.g. secret, code, etc.

values.description: The code has an unspecified vulnerability type
The code uses a dependency with a known vulnerability.
The code contains a secret that has now been compromised and must be revoked.
The code contains a weakness determined by static analysis.
High confidence level for alert
Other confidence level for alert

dismissal.description: Contains information for the dismissal of the alert if the alert has been dismissed.

firstSeenDate.description: This value is computed and returned by the service. This value represents the first time the service has seen this issue reported in an analysis instance.

fixedDate.description: This value is computed and returned by the service. If the issue is fixed, this value represents the time the service has seen this issue fixed in an analysis instance.

gitRef.description: Reference to a git object, e.g. branch ref.

hasTrustedSourceOrigin.description: Value indicates whether the alert comes from a SARIF uploaded by a trusted source.

introducedDate.description: This value is computed and returned by the service. This value represents the first time the vulnerability was introduced.

lastSeenDate.description: This value is computed and returned by the service. This value represents the last time the service has seen this issue reported in an analysis instance.

logicalLocations.description: Logical locations for the alert. This value is computed and returned by the service. It is a value based on the results from all analysis configurations. An example of a logical location is a component.

physicalLocations.description: This value is computed and returned by the service. It is a value based on the results from all analysis configurations. An example of a physical location is a file location.

projectId.description: Identifier of the project where the alert was detected.

relations.description: Relations between alerts and other artifacts.

repositoryId.description: Identifier of the repository where the alert was detected.

repositoryUrl.description: Repository URL where the alert was detected.

state.description: This value is computed and returned by the service. It is a value based on the results from all analysis configurations.

values.description: Alert is in an indeterminate state
Alert has been detected in the code
Alert was dismissed by a user
The issue is no longer detected in the code
The tool has determined that the issue is no longer a risk

title.description: Title will only be rendered as text and does not support markdown formatting. There is a maximum character limit of 256.

tools.description: Tools that have detected this issue.

truncatedSecret.description: A truncated/obfuscated version of the secret pertaining to the alert (if applicable).

validationFingerprints.description: ValidationFingerprints for the secret liveness check. Only returned on demand in Get API with Expand parameter set to be ValidationFingerprint (not returned in List API)

validityDetails.description: Validity details of an alert. Currently, this is only applicable to secret alerts. In case of secret alerts, the validity status and time is computed by looking at the liveness results for validation fingerprints associated to an alert.

AlertAnalysisInstance.description: Summary of the state of the alert for a given analysis configuration.

firstSeen.description: Analysis instance where the issue was first detected for a given analysis configuration.

fixedIn.description: Analysis instance where the issue was fixed for a given analysis configuration.

lastSeen.description: Analysis instance where the issue was last detected for a given analysis configuration.

recentAnalysisInstance.description: The most recent instatnce of the analysis.

state.description: Result state for a given analysis configuration.

values.description: Alert is in an indeterminate state
Alert has been detected in the code
Alert was dismissed by a user
The issue is no longer detected in the code
The tool has determined that the issue is no longer a risk

AlertBatchRequest.description: Request model for getting alerts by IDs with optional alert type filter.

alertIds.description: List of alert IDs to retrieve.

alertType.description: Alert type of the alert IDs.

values.description: The code has an unspecified vulnerability type
The code uses a dependency with a known vulnerability.
The code contains a secret that has now been compromised and must be revoked.
The code contains a weakness determined by static analysis.

metadata.description: A list of metadata to be associated with the alert.

errorPolicy.description: The flag to control error policy in a bulk get work items request. Possible options are {Fail, Omit}.

values.description: Fail error policy: if an alert id is not found, the whole request fails.
Omit error policy: if an alert id is not found, it will be omitted from the results.

AlertMetadataChange.description: Used to represent an update in a relationship between an alert and an artifact.

metadataChange.description: The change that occurred to the metadata.

values.description: Dismissal type unknown
Dismissal indicating alert has been fixed
Dismissal indicating user is accepting a risk for the alert
Dismissal indicating alert is a false positive and will likely not be fixed.
Dismissal indicating user is agreeing to follow license guidance.
Dismissal indicating backend detection tool was upgraded and the alert is not detected by the new version of tool.
Dismissal indicating the affected dependencency is not distributed to end users.
Alert is in an indeterminate state
Alert has been detected in the code
Alert was dismissed by a user
The issue is no longer detected in the code
The tool has determined that the issue is no longer a risk

AlertValidityInfo.description: Validity data for an alert that will be part of Alerts APIs and UI.

values.description: When there are no validation fingerprints attached to the alert.
When the validations for validation fingerprints associated to the alert have not been conclusive.
When at least one validation fingerprint associated to the alert is exploitable.
When all validation fingerprints associated to the alert are not exploitable.

AnalysisConfiguration.description: AnalysisConfiguration class models a build definition.

analysisConfigurationDetails.description: Details for the configuration. Populated values depend on the type of configuration.

values.description: Default analysis configuration that is not attached to any other configuration data
Ado Pipeline, contains branch, pipeline, phase, and ADOPipelineId

toolName.description: Name of the tool that ran on this configuration.

toolVersion.description: The latest version of the tool that ran on this configuration.

gitRef.description: Reference to a git object, e.g. branch ref.

commitId.description: CommitId is a commit id for that instance

createdDate.description: Date when the analysis was created.

instanceIdentifier.description: InstanceIdentifier is a key that uniquely establishes this instance

results.description: Results that were reported by the analysis.

url.description: Url is the permalink to the build.

values.description: Alert is in an indeterminate state
Alert has been detected in the code
Alert was dismissed by a user
The issue is no longer detected in the code
The tool has determined that the issue is no longer a risk
Indicates the component is an Npm package.
Indicates the component is a Maven artifact.
Indicates the component is a Git repository.
Indicates the component is not any of the supported component types by Governance.
Indicates the component is a Ruby gem.
Indicates the component is a Cargo package.
Indicates the component is a Pip package.
Indicates the component is a loose file. Not a package as understood by different package managers.
Indicates the component is a Go package.
Indicates the component is a Docker Image
Indicates the component is a CocoaPods pod.
Indicates the component is found in a linux environment. A package understood by linux based package managers like apt and rpm.
Indicates the component is a Conda package.
Indicates the component is a Docker Reference.
Indicates the component is a Vcpkg Package.

DependencyResult.description: An instance of a vulnerable dependency that was detected

dependency.description: Information about the vulnerable dependency that was found

resultId.description: ID for the Result that this instance belongs to

rootDependencyId.description: Heirarchal information when multiple instances are found

versionControlFilePath.description: Information about where the dependency was found

values.description: Dismissal type unknown
Dismissal indicating alert has been fixed
Dismissal indicating user is accepting a risk for the alert
Dismissal indicating alert is a false positive and will likely not be fixed.
Dismissal indicating user is agreeing to follow license guidance.
Dismissal indicating backend detection tool was upgraded and the alert is not detected by the new version of tool.
Dismissal indicating the affected dependencency is not distributed to end users.

message.description: Informational message attached to the dismissal

_links.description: This field contains zero or more interesting links about the graph subject. These links may be invoked to obtain additional relationships or more detailed information about this graph subject.

descriptor.description: The descriptor is the primary way to reference the graph subject while the system is running. This field will uniquely identify the same graph subject across both Accounts and Organizations.

displayName.description: This is the non-unique display name of the graph subject. To change this field, you must alter its value in the source provider.

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

directoryAlias.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph user referenced in the "self" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

imageUrl.description: Deprecated - Available in the "avatar" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

inactive.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph membership state referenced in the "membershipState" entry of the GraphUser "_links" dictionary

isAadIdentity.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsAadUserType/Descriptor.IsAadGroupType)

isContainer.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsGroupType)

profileUrl.description: Deprecated - not in use in most preexisting implementations of ToIdentityRef

LegalReview.description: Details for a legal review for a given component

id.description: The review id. This indicates the associated work item id for dev it's witness-dev and for prod it's ossmsft.

values.description: Information of the license has not been harvested by ClearlyDefined
Information of the license has not been harvested by ClearlyDefined
Information of the license has been harvested by ClearlyDefined
The license type is unknown or not specified.
A permissive license allows software to be freely used, modified, and distributed with minimal restrictions. Examples: MIT, Apache 2.0.
A weak copyleft license requires modifications to the software to be shared under the same license, but does not impose restrictions on larger works that include the software. Examples: LGPL.
A strong copyleft license requires that any derivative works or larger works that include the software must also be distributed under the same license. Examples: GPL.
A network copyleft license extends the copyleft requirement to software that is accessed over a network, requiring the source code to be made available. Examples: AGPL.
A license that does not fit into the standard categories or is custom-defined. In CG, it indicates a commercial license.
No assertion is made about the license type, leaving it unspecified.

kind.description: Dependency kind of this logical location.

values.description: The root dependency introduced the component being alerted.
The component being alerted.
Vulnerable Dependency. Deprecating this value. Use Component instead.

license.description: License information for Dependency Only applicable when Kind is "Component" and the alertType of the alert with this location is License

Metadata.description: The metadata operation to be performed on the alert.

op.description: The type of operation to be performed.

values.description: Represents the defualt value if the operation is not specified or not supported.
Represents the addition of the metadata.
Represents the removal of the metadata.

MetadataChange.description: The change that has been made to the metadata.

changeType.description: The type of change on the metadata.

value.description: Represents a metadata association to an alert.

PhysicalLocation.description: Location in the source control system where the issue was found

filePath.description: Path of the file where the issue was found

isValidGitPath.description: Indicates whether the path is a valid Git path that exists in the git repository associated with the alert.

region.description: Details about the location where the issue was found including a snippet

versionControl.description: Source control system-specific information about the location

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

columnEnd.description: The column where the code snippet ends

columnStart.description: The column where the code snippet starts

lineEnd.description: The line number where the code snippet ends

lineStart.description: The line number where the code snippet starts

RelationMetadata.description: The metadata to be associated with the alert.

attributes.description: Any additional attributes of the metadata.

dependencyResult.description: Additional information about the alert.  Valid when ResultType is Dependency

fingerprint.description: Full fingerprint of the Result.  This is used to detect duplicate instances of the same alert

fingerprintId.description: Unique ID of the fingerprint of the Result

resultMessage.description: Detailed description of the rule that triggered the alert

resultType.description: The type of rule that triggered the alert

values.description: The result was found from an unspecified analysis type
The result was found from dependency analysis
The result was found from static code analysis

ruleId.description: ID of the rule that the triggered the alert

ruleShortDescription.description: Short description of the rule that triggered the alert

versionControlResult.description: Additional information about the alert.  Valid when ResultType is VersionControl

Rule.description: The analysis rule that caused the alert.

additionalProperties.description: Additional properties of this rule dependent on the rule type.  For example, dependency rules may include the CVE ID if it is available.

description.description: Description of what this rule detects

resources.description: Markdown-formatted list of resources to learn more about the Rule. In some cases, RuleInfo.AdditionalProperties.advisoryUrls is used instead.

values.description: The job type when it is new
The job type when it is queued
The job type when it is completed
The job type when it fails
The job type when it is queued on exception

If provided, only return alerts with the ids specified.
Otherwise, return any alert.

values.description: The code has an unspecified vulnerability type

The code contains a weakness determined by static analysis.

confidenceLevels.description:
If provided, only return alerts at these confidence levels.
Both High and Other need to be specified to fetch alerts of all confidence levels.
Otherwise, return alerts with high confidence level.
Only applicable for secret alerts.

values.description: High confidence level for alert
Other confidence level for alert

dependencyName.description:
If provided, only alerts for this dependency are returned.
Otherwise, return alerts for all dependencies.
In a sarif submission, a dependency (or a component) is specified in result.RelatedLocations[].logicalLocation.
Not applicable for secret alerts.

fromDate.description:
If provided, only return alerts last seen after this date.
Otherwise return all alerts.

hasLinkedWorkItems.description:
If provided, filters alerts based on whether they have linked work items.
Set to "true" to return only alerts with linked work items.
Set to "false" to return only alerts without linked work items.
If not provided, returns all alerts regardless of linked work items.
Not applicable for secret and dependency scanning alerts.

keywords.description: If provided, only return alerts whose titles match this pattern.

modifiedSince.description:
If provided, only return alerts that were modified since this date.
Otherwise return all alerts.

onlyDefaultBranch.description:
If true or not set, only return alerts found on the default branch of the repository.
If there have been no runs completed on the default branch, the last run is used instead regardless of the branch used for that run. If false, return alerts from all branches.
This option is ignored if ref is provided.
Not applicable for secret alerts.

phaseId.description:
If provided with pipelineName, only return alerts detected in this pipeline phase
Otherwise, return alerts detected in all phases.
Not applicable for secret alerts.

phaseName.description:
If provided with pipelineName, only return alerts detected in this pipeline phase
Otherwise, return alerts detected in all phases.
Not applicable for secret alerts.

pipelineName.description:
If provided, only return alerts detected in this pipeline.
Otherwise, return alerts detected in all pipelines.
Not applicable for secret alerts.

ref.description:
If provided, only include alerts for this ref.
If not provided and OnlyDefaultBranch is true, only include alerts found on the default branch or last run branch if there is no analysis configuration for the default branch.
Otherwise, include alerts from all branches.
Not applicable for secret alerts.

ruleId.description:
If provided, only return alerts for this rule.
Otherwise, return alerts of all rules.

Otherwise, return alerts for all rules.

Otherwise, return alerts at any severity.

Otherwise, return alerts in any state.

rules.description: The rules that the tool defines

confidenceLevels.description: Display alerts for specified confidence levels. Show alerts for all confidence levels. if none are specified.

values.description: High confidence level for alert
Other confidence level for alert

packages.description: Display alerts for specified packages. Show alerts for all packages if none are specified.

pipelines.description: Display alerts for specified pipelines. Show alerts for all pipelines if none are specified.

rules.description: Display alerts for specified rules. Show alerts for all rules if none are specified.

secretTypes.description: Display alerts for specified secret types. Show alerts for all secret types if none are specified.

severities.description: Display alerts for specified severities. Show alerts for all severities if none are specified.

validity.description: Display alerts for specified validity. Show alerts for all validities if none are specified.

values.description: When there are no validation fingerprints attached to the alert.
When the validations for validation fingerprints associated to the alert have not been conclusive.

assetFingerprint.description: The key value representation of the asset fingerprint.

c3Id.description: Represents the CrossCompanyCorrelatingId for the secret in the ValidationFingerprintJson.

validationFingerprintHash.description: The hash associated to the secret.

validationFingerprintJson.description: The JSON representation of the secret. Be aware that this field may contain the secret in its unencrypted form. Please exercise caution when using this field.

validityLastUpdatedDate.description: The date when the validity was last updated.

values.description: Default value, no information about the secret can be inferred from this.
Represents a secret that can be used to connect to a resource.
Represents a secret that can't be used to connect to a resource.
Represents a secret where no determination can be made about its exploitability.
Represents a secret where we are unable to validate, e.g. dynamic validator missing.
Represents a secret where the validation process failed due to a transient error, e.g. network issue. This result indicates that the validation process should be retried.

ValidationRequestInfo.description: Data associated to a validation request for an alert. Along with the request status, this includes the validity data that is part of Get Alert(s) response.

values.description: Default, when the request status is not set/applicable.
First validation request for the alert's validation fingerprints, created when the sarif is submitted for processing.
The secret validation jobs for the alert's validation fingerprints have been manually queued and at least one is still in progress.
All the secret validation jobs for the alert's validation fingerprints have returned Completed or Failed.
This status is set only when there is an exception in the ValidationService.

VersionControlDetails.description: Information for locating files in a source control system

filePath.description: Path of the file in the version control system

filePathHash.description: Hash of the file in the version control system

versionControlFilePathId.description: Unique ID for the file in the version control system

resultId.description: The ID to associate this structure with the cooresponding Result

versionControlSnippet.description: Information about the snippet where the Result was found

endColumn.description: column in the code file where the snippet ends

endLine.description: line in the code file where the snippet ends

startColumn.description: column in the code file where the snippet starts

startLine.description: line in the code file where the snippet starts

versionControlFilePath.description: path of the code file in the version control system

versionControlFilePathId.description: Unique Id number for the file path

versionControlSnippetId.description: Unique Id number for this snippet

VssJsonCollectionWrapper.description: This class is used to serialize collections as a single JSON object on the wire.

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

api-Version-preview.2.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.2.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.2' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.advsec: Grants the ability to read alerts, result instances, analysis result instances
scopes.vso.advsec_write: Grants the ability to upload analyses in sarif
scopes.vso.advsec_manage: Grants the ability to access sarif upload information, delete analysis, and update alerts
